All poles in Left Half-Plane.

Re(s) < 0 for all poles. No poles on or right of jω-axis.

UNSTABLE!

Growing exponential e^(σt) with σ>0. Bounded inputs cause unbounded outputs.

Stable (decaying response).

e^(σt) with σ<0 decays to zero. Transients die out.

Marginally stable.

Sustained oscillation. Bounded but doesn't decay. Resonance possible.

UNSTABLE!

Gives t·sin(ωt) terms. Factor t grows unbounded.

Decaying oscillation.

Re=-2<0: stable/decaying. Im=3: oscillates at 3 rad/s.

∫|h(t)|dt < ∞

Absolutely integrable impulse response = BIBO stable.

Build table from characteristic polynomial.
Count sign changes in first column = RHP poles.
No sign changes = stable.

Marginally stable.

Gives u(t) term—constant that never decays. Example: integrator.

UNSTABLE!

Gives t·u(t) term—ramp growing forever.
